official_title: A bill to amend title III of the Public Health Service Act to enhance the Nation's capacity to address public health threats and emergencies.
short_title: Public Health Threats and Emergencies Act

summary.text: Public Health Threats and Emergencies Act - Amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize the Secretary of Health and Human Services, upon determining that a disease or disorder presents a public health emergency or that a public health emergency otherwise exists, to take appropriate action to respond, including conducting and supporting investigations into the cause, treatment, or prevention of the disease or disorder. Establishes the Public Health Emergency Fund to support such activities. Requires an annual report from the Secretary to specified congressional committees on Fund expenditures and the emergencies for which they were made.Requires the Secretary to: (1) establish reasonable capacities appropriate for national, State, and local public health systems and their work forces to detect and respond effectively to significant public health threats; (2) award grants to determine the extent to which States or local public health agencies can achieve such capacities; and (3) award grants to address core public health capacity needs. Requires related reports. Authorizes appropriations.Authorizes appropriations for FY 2001 through 2010 for the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention for defending and combating public health threats of the 21st century.Directs the Secretary to establish: (1) an Antimicrobial Resistance Task Force to provide advice and recommendations to the Secretary on Federal programs relating to antimicrobial resistance; and (2) a joint interdepartmental working group on preparedness and readiness for the medical and public health effects of a bioterrorist attack. Authorizes appropriations. Requires: (1) research and development of new antimicrobial drugs and diagnostics; (2) educational programs for medical and health personnel in the use of antibiotics; and (3) grants to establish demonstration programs promoting the judicious use of antimicrobial drugs and the control of the spread of antimicrobial-resistant pathogens.Requires a report from the Comptroller General to specified congressional committees on Federal activities related to research, preparedness, and management of the public health and medical consequences of a bioterrorist attack against the civilian population. Authorizes appropriations.
